Screenshots and Explanation

Collection Setup in Strapi

This is how I have set up my collections for a blog in Strapi. Each blog entry has the following mandatory fields:

  • Title: The main title of the blog post
  • Description: A brief description of the content
  • Cover Image: The main image that represents the blog post
  • Date Published: The date the blog was published

JavaScript Screenshot

This code is an asynchronous function to retrieve blog data from a Strapi API and return it:

  • Loads fetch for making HTTP requests.
  • Sends a request to Strapi's endpoint (http://localhost:1337/api/my-blogs?populate=*).
  • Converts the response to JSON format.
  • Logs any errors and returns an empty array if something goes wrong.

The Blog

Collection Setup in Contentful

!

Similar to Strapi

This code connects to Contentful to retrieve and return entries from a specific content type called myblog:

  • Initializes a Contentful client using the createClient method from the Contentful library.
  • Uses two environment variables (CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID and CONTENTFUL_ACCESS_TOKEN) for authentication. space identifies which Contentful project to use, while accessToken is like a password to access its content securely.
  • client.getEntries({ content_type: 'myblog' }) sends a request to retrieve entries specifically from the myblog content type.
  • entries.items contains the actual list of myblog entries, which are returned.

The Contentful Blog
